newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Ricoh Euro-distribtion centre to be at Schiphol.
newsitem.headline: Ricoh Euro-distribtion centre to be at Schiphol.

text.p: Ricoh, the Japanese manufacturer of cameras and electronic equipment, is to build its European distribution centre at Schiphol.
Work will start next week on the 28,000 sq m European Spare Parts Centre (ESPC), said managing director of Schiphol Area Development Corporation (SADC), Willem Trommels.
Eventually, some 15,000 parts a month will be distributed from the site to Europe, Africa and the Middle East.

SADC is responsible for preparing the site at Schiphol South East's airport business park for Ricoh. SADC is working together with NBM Amstelland, a Dutch constructor, on the project. Ricoh's centre is expected to be operational by spring 1998, he said.
"It is our aim to prepare the land for companies and to market Schiphol for airport-related investments. If a company wants a turn-key site we work together with local contractors," said Trommels.

The company has been particularly successful attracting companies from Japan and the U.S. to Schiphol, he said, although companies from Taiwan, Korea, Sweden, Germany and France are showing growing interest.

Japan's Yamaha has the largest European distribution centre at Schiphol. The Japanese firm has its European headquarters, ESPC and test centre on a 70,000 sq m site. Canon also has its European parts centre at Schiphol.
Yesterday, Californian-based Seagate, the U.S. disc drive manufacturer, opened a 20,000 sq m European distribution centre at Schiphol.
SADC has 450 hectares available for development area for logistics, distribution, office, warehouse and research and development activities.
Trommels is hopeful that negotiations going-on with other companies at the moment, will be successful in the next few months. - Reuters Air Cargo Service Tel+ 44 171 542 7706 Fax +5017 - www.racs.com
